Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with an angular shoulder and a short rounded nozzle set off by a double scroll. The discus is decorated with Phthonos, a male figure with his hands to his throat, surrounded by animals and birds. On each side is a lug-handle. The base is undefined.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2084)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine (trustees)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
